Reimplemented in CComboBox.

int CList::setItems ( char ** items,
int num = 0 )
 

Sets the list to the string array items num specifies the numbers of entries if num is 0 or missing, the end of the list is determined by an zero pointer

int CList::getItems ( char *** items,
int * num )
 

Gets the complete list as an array of strings (char *). num is set to the number of strings

char * CList::getItem ( int position )
 

Gets the item at <position>. Returns 0 in case of error

int CList::setInflateBalloonFunction ( PtListBalloonF_t inflateBalloonFunction )
 

A function that inflates a balloon for the item the pointer is on. PtListBalloonF_t is a function type:

typedef PtWidget_t *PtListBalloonF_t( PtWidget_t *widget, PtWidget_t *parent, PhArea_t *area, PtListColumn_t const *col, int coln, const char *item, unsigned index, const char *font);

int CList::setLineSpacing ( int lineSpacing )
 

The line spacing between the items in the list.

Returns the first selected item

int CList::getAllSelectedPositions ( unsigned short ** selectedPosition )
 

Gets all selected positions in the list. Returns the number of selected positions. The pointer <selectedPositions> is changed to point to the position array

int CList::getNumSelectedPositions ( )
 

Returns the number of selected positions in the list

int CList::getItemPosition ( char * name )
 

This function performs a linear search on the list for the specified item. If it finds the item, the function returns the item's position. Otherwise, it returns 0.
